segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is, just standing in the water like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so reckless, climbing on that stool to get cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is just standing there, waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should be paying more attention to what’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the floor, and she’s just drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far that the stool is about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see what’s going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a mess, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t get hurt, but someone needs to stop him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely oblivious, and it’s frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
